name: Combat Modifier: Grapple Disarm
desc: Once already in a Grapple, as part of their declaration phase a character can declare they are attempting a Grapple Disarm to disarm their opponent. The character attempting the Grapple Disarm must be Unarmed. They gain Advantage their Unarmed combat roll versus the armed grappled opponent. The armed opponent gains Disadvantage on their combat roll versus the character grappling them. The character attempting the Grapple Disarm may only take the Disarm Level 2 Victory (this means they cannot delegate their attack to inflict an injury or execute a trip regardless of how high the victory achieved.)

name: Space Vacuum Life Support
desc: Enable the user to survive in the vacuum of space until onboard oxygen depletes.

name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: Acts as a Spellcasting Focus for spells.

name: Magic Resource Leech
desc: Sneak attack regain 1 Magic Resource of the user's choice.

name: Life Leech
desc: Sneak attacks trigger an Minor Heal to self.

name: Minorly Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +2 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +4 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Greatly Enhanced Magic Resource
desc: +6 to magic Resource capacity.

name: Ariel Assassin
desc: While performing an aerial attack, gain a +1 to your victory level.

name: Minorly Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 1d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 2d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Greatly Enhanced Vitality
desc: Reduce up to 3d6 of total injury penalty dice.

name: Enhanced Critical
desc: +1 automatic win to sneak attacks and Physically Incapacitated opponents.

name: Dragon Threat Sense
desc: The character gets an uneasy feeling when there are draconic creatures near.

name: Dragon Breath Resistance
desc: Minor Resistance vs dragon elemental attacks (Dragonfire, Dragontide, Soulfire, ect)

name: Enhanced Healing
desc: Any healing acts as the tier above.

name: Blessing of the Moon
desc: INT is set to level 2. Gain the following disabling: "I hear the sword whispering its secrets to me, and I must know them"

name: Innate Mind Reading
desc: Magically access the surface thoughts of a creature within 60 ft as long as concentration isn't broken. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead obstruct the ability. While reading the mind of a create, gains advantage to Communication checks versus the creature.

name: Spore Follower
desc: Without the presence of a spore evolved, this creature will behave as a brain dead monster. But under direction will follow orders and use weapons.

name: Spore Carrier
desc: Carries the spore fungal infection. Creatures injured are infected with the spore disease. Upon death, the fungal growth hardens into a brittle stone like substance.

name: Incorporeal Form
desc: Can move through physical objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain.

name: Ending
desc: Creatures killed with this weapon are instantly decapitated.

name: Splinter
desc: Any weapon dice added to a combat roll are considered automatic wins when attacking a plant based creature (Leshens, Nature Dragons) or wooden structures.

name: Extendable Weapon
desc: This weapon can shrink to the size of a small weapon, extend up to reach weapon, as well as any size between. The force of the weapon extending can be used in a variety of way.

name: Fire Repair and Enhancement
desc: Weapons repairs in intense fires. If fully repaired and is exposed to increasingly intense flames, it will become a higher tier item. Each time it is upgraded, a more intense fire is required upgrade it.

name: Apparel Storage
desc: This small mirror can save an outfit the user is wearing. If no outfit is stored inside the user will appear naked in the reflection while holding it. Pressing the mirror while looking into it will swap your apparel between your reflection and what you are currently wearing. This happens in a flash of light, similar to the glare off a mirror. This allows the users to store an outfit inside of the necklace.

name: Retractable Shield
desc: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

name: Light Bound
desc: This weapon is physical light, and can be absorbed and summoned by a those with the Radiance magic skill.

name: Metal Feeding
desc: To repair, item can feed on metal. Different amounts result in different levels of repair and time needed to complete these repairs.

name: Command Asclepius
desc: By holding and speaking the command word "Asclepius" the user may instruct this Runecraft to perform various simple actions. "Asclepius, turn into a whip, or short spear." or Asclepius, attack those soldiers."

name: Swordbreaker Blade Catch
desc: Any weapon that could reasonably be caught in the swordbreaker can be caught with a Lvl 1 victory, entering into Close Quarters combat. The opponent's weapon is usable while bound. Your main hand weapon (Small, Medium, or Large) can be used in this Close Quarters combat scenario.

name: Indestructible
desc: This item can't lose durability.

name: Moonlight Greatsword
desc: Just by thought, this ancient sword wreathed in moonlight, becoming a greatsword wreathed in moonlight. While active, it becomes a greatsword and now additionally deals radiant damage.

name: Binding of the Moon
desc: This weapon can only be picked up by those who sing (out loud or in their head) the Lullaby of the Moon. If the weapon is held for a fortnight, the weapon is bound to the users, severing the bond with the previous bearer. The bearer can now dismiss and summon the blade at will.

name: Phenomena Detection
desc: Beats and lights up when turned towards supernatural phenomena in an area. Beats faster the closer it is.

name: Forbidden Whispers
desc: When one squeezes the Heart, it whispers secrets directly into their mind concerning the current area, as it senses information about the world beyond mortal recognition. When the Heart is pointed at a person, it reveals secrets about them. Roll a destiny roll (a d20) to determine the level of information obtained.

name: Light Storage
desc: Holds 1 Magic Resource worth of light. Can be recharged in Sunlight. Light slowly dissipates from this gem.

name: Retractable Shield
desc: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

name: Defense Spells
desc: The staff is endowed with 10 charges, serving as the fuel for the enclosed spells. When holding the staff, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from it, provided you have a vocation that can unlock the magic required for these spells: Physical Protection (1 charge) or Mage Shield (2 charges). No components are necessary. At the break of dawn, the staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges. Should the staff exhaust its charges entirely, roll a d20. If the result is 1, the staff shatters and meets its destruction.

name: Single-use Invisibility
desc: Applies the Invisibility Spell to the user of this item after being used. Item is destroyed in the process.

name: Draupnir
desc: This ring can transform between a weapon and ring. The ring is endowed with 10 charges. With the ring equipped, the user can force a duplication resulting in either a ring or weapon, both which appear in the users hand. Duplicates can not transform, only the original. At the break of dawn, the ring regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges.

name: Cold Enchantment
desc: Weapon additionally deals Cold damage.

name: The Anatoli Curse
desc: The weapon is cursed on an individual, always return to the user no matter how the weapon is disposed. When this item is used in combat, the bearer becomes blood lusted with each subsequent kill, becoming increasingly bestially minded, possibly even attack friends.

name: Sense: Keen Hearing
desc: Advantage on hearing based Perception checks.

name: Sense: Keen Smell
desc: Advantage on smell based Perception checks.

name: Sense: Keen Sight
desc: Advantage on sight based Perception checks.

name: Sense: Darkvision
desc: A special ability that many creatures in fantasy realms, particularly those that live underground, possess. This ability allows a creature to see in dim light as if it were bright light, and see in darkness as if it were dim light up to a certain distance. However, the trade-off is that they can't distinguish colors in the dark, only different shades of gray. Within 60 feet, sees dim light as if it were bright light and darkness as if it were dim light, though devoid of color.

name: Sense: Enhanced Darkvision
desc: A special ability that many creatures in fantasy realms, particularly those that live underground, possess. This ability allows a creature to see in dim light as if it were bright light, and see in darkness as if it were dim light up to a certain distance. However, the trade-off is that they can't distinguish colors in the dark, only different shades of gray. Within 120 feet, sees dim light as if it were bright light and darkness as if it were dim light, though devoid of color.

name: Sense: Blindsight
desc: Blindsight allows a creature to perceive its environment without the need for sight, within a certain range. It's typically found in creatures that lack eyes, such as oozes, or in those that have heightened senses or use echolocation, like bats and true dragons. These creatures can sense their surroundings regardless of visual obstructions or conditions. Within 30 ft, the environment can be perceived without the need for sight.

name: Sense: Truesight
desc: A being possessing truesight can, within a designated range, perceive both in regular and magical darkness, observe invisible entities and objects, effortlessly discern visual illusions, succeed on skill checks against them, and discern the true form of a shapechanger or a creature altered by magic. Additionally, this creature has the ability to see into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Vision Obscurement: Unobscured
desc: The area around the character doesn't impede their vision. Roll normal Perception checks that rely on sight.

name: Vision Obscurement: Lightly Obscured
desc: The area around the character slighly impedes their vision. Roll at Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight. Examples include dim light, patchy fog/foliage, ect...

name: Vision Obscurement: Heavily Obscured
desc: The area around the character heavily impedes their vision. Roll at Super Disadvantage on Perception checks that relay on sight. Examples include deep shadow, moderate fog/foliage, ect...

name: Vision Obscurement: Completely Obscured
desc: The area around the character completely impedes their vision. Character is considered Blinded (see the Condition). Examples include complete darkness, opaque fog/foliage, ect...

name: Light: Glow
desc: Provides 20 ft radius bright light and 40 ft radius dim light.

name: Destiny Resistance
desc: "Post Roll Destiny Points" cannot be spent against this character.

name: Destiny Immunity
desc: Destiny Points cannot be spent against this character.
